error.signature: Istio sidecar injection failed: webhook connect error or sidecar not injected

verdict.summary: Istio sidecar proxy is not injected into pods. Namespace label missing, webhook down, or injection explicitly disabled.

dead_ends.action: Manually add the istio-proxy container to every pod spec
dead_ends.why_fails: Version mismatches, missing environment config, and maintenance nightmare

dead_ends.action: Disable mTLS globally instead of fixing injection
dead_ends.why_fails: Removes service mesh security â€” traffic is unencrypted

workarounds.action: Label the namespace for automatic injection: kubectl label namespace <ns> istio-injection=enabled
workarounds.how: kubectl label namespace <ns> istio-injection=enabled && kubectl rollout restart deployment -n <ns>

workarounds.action: Check istiod is running and the webhook is configured: kubectl get mutatingwebhookconfiguration istio-sidecar-injector
workarounds.how: kubectl get pods -n istio-system -l app=istiod to verify the control plane is healthy

leads_to.condition: when sidecar is injected but fails to start

preceded_by.condition: when Istio's webhook is misconfigured and blocks pod creation

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Sidecar injection failure means the proxy container isn't added at all, while sidecar-not-ready means it's injected but fails to start
